transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good morning, sneha. welcome to the interview for the e-commerce analyst role. how are you doing today?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: good morning. im doing well, thank you. im happy to be here.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: before we begin, id like to explain how todays interview will go. well talk about your background, your analytical skills, and your exposure to e-commerce data and metrics. lets start with a brief introduction. can you tell me about your experience?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: sure. i have around two years of experience working as an analyst. i mostly work with excel and basic sql to prepare reports and dashboards for internal teams.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thats good. have you worked specifically with e-commerce platforms or online sales data?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: not directly. my work has mostly been on internal operational data, not specifically e-commerce platforms.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: okay. lets talk about analytics. what excel functions do you commonly use in your day-to-day work?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i regularly use vlookup, if formulas, pivot tables, and some basic charts.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain how a pivot table helps in analysis?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: pivot tables help summarize large datasets and make it easier to analyze totals and trends.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: good. now lets move to sql. can you explain a simple select query?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: select is used to fetch data from a table, and we can use where to filter the results.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you used joins in sql?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have basic knowledge of joins, but i dont use them very frequently.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: since this is an e-commerce analyst role, are you familiar with metrics like conversion rate, average order value, or cart abandonment?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: i have heard of these terms, but i havent worked on analyzing them directly.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: can you explain what conversion rate means in an e-commerce context?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: conversion rate is related to users buying products, but i dont know the exact calculation.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: have you ever analyzed customer journeys or sales funnels?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no, i havent worked on funnel analysis yet.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: alright. thank you for your honesty. do you have any questions for us?

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: no questions at the moment. thank you for the opportunity.

transcript.speaker: interviewer
transcript.text: thank you, sneha. it was nice speaking with you. well get back to you with the next steps.

transcript.speaker: candidate
transcript.text: thank you. have a great day.
